content.description: Start on the far left side of the overhanging face with both hands on a large, right facing undercling/sidepull. With your feet out wide right, bump your left hand to a four finger sloped ledge, cut your feet or work them left, then make a huge bump to a larger, black sloper on the left side of the boulder. Work your feet, grab the high right hand jug, and top out. Watch for the smaller boulder to the left when topping out.
content.protection: 2 pads (one for smaller boulder to the left).
content.location: It is on the left side of the overhanging face.

content.description: This problem is a direct start.  Your right hand is on a sloping crimp, your left hand is on a gaston.  Both feet are flagged far out right.  The crux is from the start to the next move out left to a sloping jug, then work your way up from there and top out.  The top out is a little dirty.
content.protection: Crash pad.  It has a nice cleared out landing.
content.location: The route starts just a little to the right and below the top out bulge.

climbs.name: Don't Talk Trash To The Garbage Man

content.description:
This is a SDS problem.  The start is on the bottom right as you look at the overhanging face.  There is a nice undercling that you can use in various ways to start, either as undercling, sidepull, or crimps.  The feet start must remain on the large boulder.  Keep them off the separate small rock that is below the boulder. Work your way up to two slopers then work left, staying off the top of the rock, and only using the slopers and meager crimps.  After working left, you will then be positioned as you start the

Soiled Pajamas

route.  Then finish the route as you would the

Soiled Pajamas

route.
content.location: The start is a very large undercling on the bottom right of the overhanging face of the Hobo Boulder.

content.description:
This is a SDS problem.  It starts the same way you would start

Don't Talk Trash To The Garbage Man

and works straight up over the small bulge.  Start how you want on the giant undercling (as undercling sidepull or crimps).  Your feet must remain on the large boulder, and you cannot use the small rock under the main boulder for your feet.  The first moves from the start will go straight up to slopers.  Then reach further over the bulge and top out.  The crux is either the first move or the top out and/or both!
content.protection: Crashpad.  There is a stump close to the SDS, so a crashpad is highly recommended.
content.location: This route is on Hobo Boulder.  Looking at the south overhanging face, you will start on the bottom right of the boulder on the giant undercling/sidepull.
